Justification: This is a common cause of heel pain, especially in runners. It is caused by inflammation of the plantar fascia, a thick band of tissue that runs along the bottom of the foot.
This is another common cause of heel pain. It is caused by inflammation of the Achilles tendon, which connects the calf muscles to the heel bone.
This is a bony growth on the heel bone that can cause pain. It is often associated with plantar fasciitis.
